Overview
Mastercard award-winning Decision Management Platform (DMP) delivers industry leading intelligence with business agility at global scale to power products that protect our customers from fraud, impede crimes such as human trafficking and terrorism, provide customers control over their spend, protect Mastercard from financial risk, and earn significant revenue.
Processing over 1.5 billion transactions per day in tens of milliseconds each at over 65,000 transactions per second, DMP leverages innovative new technologies including multi-layered AI engines, real time feature stores leverage extreme performance in memory data grids, a streaming big data cluster, business intelligence tooling, self-service business rule capabilities, and web apps & API for providing customers control and insights for their decisions.

Job Title
Software Engineer I

Role
The Mastercard Decision Management Program has an exciting opportunity for strong, innovative Software Engineers to join our innovation team and develop the next generation of cloud-native high throughput, low latency AI-driven intelligent transaction processing services.
In this role, you will research new approaches to solving critical problem in the Payment decisioning space and validate them implementing Proof-of-Concepts leveraging event-driven and microservice architecture in an agile delivery process.
We are looking for engineers who can bring unique perspectives and innovative ideas to all areas of development and are interested in continuing to improve our platform through the ever-changing technology landscape.

Job Title
Lead Software Development Engineer
Overview

Are you a software engineer who wants to work for a company that offers above and beyond benefits including paid parental leave, flexible work hours, gift matching, and even volunteer incentives? Do you want to work in an inclusive and nurturing culture that encourages your own professional learning and development? At Mastercard, our industry expertise is enhanced by our commitment to being a force for good in the world. We do well by doing good. Our core values of trust, partnership, agility and thoughtful risk taking are displayed in everything we do. Our culture of collaboration and inclusion makes our company the place where the best people choose to be. Come join us!

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. Mastercard Data & Services enables customers across industries and geographies to make smarter decisions and reach better outcomes with a tailored portfolio of solutions.

Lead Software Development Engineering in Data & Services
As a Lead Software Development Engineer on the Data & Services Technologies team, you’ll hold a valued role within a rapidly growing and successful business unit, working closely with experienced and driven senior engineers to solve problems as a team. Innovative product opportunities, modern business questions, and intricate datasets present uniquely challenging problems that we are eager to take on. The Mastercard D&S next-generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies. Our fintech software unlocks business insights from massive datasets in an interactive platform to drive multi-million dollar business decisions for our clients. We are rapidly expanding our product offerings and innovating on how we deliver our solutions. We are looking for an innovative software engineer with front end expertise who can play a leading role in helping us scale our platform development and tackle the big challenges of the future.

As a member of the Mastercard Intelligence team, you will bring your technical knowledge and development skills to build, deploy, and scale real-time interactive applications for thousands of clients across the globe. The team will consist of developers focused on building a platform that leverages Mastercard data and combines it with 3rd party and clients' data to power applications that help track performance and identify untapped opportunities. You will have the chance to build a high-performance analytics platform that advances how businesses all over the world unleash the most value from Mastercard data. You will play a vital role within a rapidly growing organization while working closely with experienced and driven engineers to solve challenging problems.

Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to feature design, building, and testing. The range of work you encounter can vary from front-end web development (Is this true? -Jason) to writing server-side calculation code to database work. There are no rigid organizational structures at Mastercard; each team uses processes that work the best for that team's members and projects.

Overview

At Mastercard, our industry expertise is enhanced by our commitment to being a force for good in the world and to doing well by doing good. The Mastercard Way encourages us and connects us with the behaviors that represent the essence of what we do and who we are as an organization. Sounds Interesting? We'll keep reading because we would love to meet you.
We are seeking a Manager, Software Engineering in the Mastercard Connect Program. Mastercard Connect is the secure global platform where Mastercard customers come to onboard, enroll, service, and grow their business with us. It's also where Mastercard employees can engage with those customers to deliver a best-in-class experience that supports their business needs.

Manager, Software Engineering will be responsible for leading overall delivery of large-scale engineering projects in the Connect Program. This individual will use their full-stack development knowledge to guide the team in advancing the Connect Experience in order to provide the best customer experience. They will raise the bar on technical excellence, show thought leadership, and ensure team delivery commitments are met. This role will be based in our Mastercard technology location in New York City Tech Hub, located in Mid-Town Manhattan which provides a state-of-the-art environment for technology teams to thrive in collaborative, Agile Engineering Culture.

Job Title
Principal Software Engineer
As a Principal Architect, you will lead the design and development of the new services and data pipelines for the success of the commercial technology integration of Dynamic Yield with Mastercard Data & Services and other Mastercard products!

Dynamic Yield is the newest addition to Mastercard’s existing suite of services. It is a state-of-the-art software-as-a-service (SaaS) personalization platform and decision engine company that helps businesses deliver digital customer experiences that are personalized, optimized, and synchronized across any touchpoints.

You will play a significant role in designing, developing, and commercializing new services focused on product synergies across MA data and Services and the Dynamic yield products. These synergies will help businesses of all sizes deliver individualized product recommendations, offers, and content based on a range of factors, including past purchases, page views, time of day, current store traffic, and trending products – all in real time to their customers.

As an international business, the software capabilities you design for Mastercard will operate at a massive scale requiring a focus on performance, security, and reliability.

Job Title: Software Engineer II

Overview

As a Software Engineer in Data & Services, you will have the opportunity to build high-performance analytics platform that advance how businesses all over the world unleash the most value from their data. Our next generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies. You will play a vital role within a rapidly growing organization, while working closely with experienced and driven engineers to solve challenging problems.

As a member of the Mastercard Intelligence team, you will help build applications on-premise and in the cloud to support terabyte-scale data ingest and real-time interactive applications for thousands of clients. The team focuses on transforming the raw Mastercard data, producing derived elements off the transaction data, and combining those with other data provided by 3rd parties and clients to power applications that help clients track performance and identify underperforming groups of customers. This team is consistently faced with challenges around processing large data sets, scaling out calculation performance as data volumes grow, and building high-value analytics off data at this scale.

The teams work in small, flexible groups and every team member contributes to feature design, building, and testing. The range of work you encounter varies from building data pipelines to working on web apps to writing server-side calculation code to performance turning of large workloads. There are no rigid organizational structures at Mastercard; each team uses processes that work the best for that team's members and projects.

Job Title

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview
In the Payment Networks organization, we are responsible for driving global commerce and enabling all transaction types that come through the Mastercard network. Our team is responsible for the customer experience, testing tools, and customer testing environment to ensure all systems are working as expected.

As a software engineering manager at Mastercard, you will be responsible for the analysis, design, development and delivery of software solutions. You will also define requirements for new applications and customizations, adhering to standards, processes and best practices.

Who is Mastercard?
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere, by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships, and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better business results.

Technology at Mastercard
What we create today will define tomorrow. Revolutionary technologies that reshape the digital economy to be more connected and inclusive than ever before. Safer, faster, more sustainable.
And we need the best people to do it. Technologists who are energized by the challenges of a truly global network. With the talent and vision to create the critical systems and products that power global commerce and connect people everywhere to the vital goods and services they need every day.
Working at Mastercard means being part of a unique culture. Inclusive and diverse, a rich collaboration of ideas and perspectives. A place that celebrates your strengths, values your experiences, and offers you the flexibility to shape a career across disciplines and continents. And the opportunity to work alongside experts and leaders at every level of the business, improving what exists, and inventing what’s next.
About the role
Software Engineers at Mastercard design and code artificial intelligence, cloud, and machine learning platforms that provide mission-critical insights to many of the world’s leading organizations and governments. As a Software Engineer, you will deliver these products and solutions with speed and agility as part of a small team. This will involve developing high-performing, highly scalable software solutions and products for some of the world’s top brands. Specific tasks vary depending on the project and the business unit that you join in.
All staff at Mastercard are expected to demonstrate 'Mastercard Way' cultural values every day - own it, simplify it, sense of urgency, thoughtful risk-taking, unlock potential, and be inclusive – with a relentless focus on our customers. culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Lead Software Development Engineer (Data team)
Overview

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. MasterCard Data & Services enables customers across industries and geographies to make smarter decisions and reach better outcomes with a tailored portfolio of solutions beyond the transaction.

Lead Software Development Engineering in Data & Services
As a Lead Software Development Engineer on the Data & Services Technologies team, you’ll hold a valued role within a rapidly growing and successful business unit, working closely with experienced and driven senior engineers to solve problems as a team. Innovative product opportunities, modern business questions, and intricate datasets present uniquely challenging problems that we are eager to take on. The Mastercard D&S next-generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies to face these problems. We are looking for an innovative software engineer who can play a leading role in helping us scale our platform development and tackle the big challenges of the future.

As a member of the Mastercard Intelligence team, you will bring your technical knowledge and full-stack development skills to build, deploy, and scale real-time interactive applications for thousands of clients across the globe. The team supports a data platform that leverages the Mastercard data along with 3rd party and client data to track performance and identify underperforming groups of customers. Our next-generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies. You will play a vital role within a rapidly growing team, working closely with experienced and driven engineers, to solve these challenging problems.

Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to feature design, building, and testing. The range of work you encounter varies from front-end web development to writing server-side calculation code to database work. There are no rigid organizational structures at Mastercard; each team uses processes that work the best for that team's members and projects.

Job Title
DevOps Engineer II
The NPP BizOps team is looking for a BizOps Engineer who can help us solve problems, build our CI/CD pipeline and lead Mastercard in DevOps automation and best practices.


Business Operations is leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Role

The role of business operations is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services.

A business operations engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organisations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper-focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every biz ops team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience and increase the overall value of supported applications.

Biz Ops teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of biz ops is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.

Role


For team members supporting the Application through monitoring:

Work on an emerging application that is high profile connecting many financial institutions with a wide range of available networks for transactions processing, clearing, and settlement.

You must have a drive to learn new development skills and the software engineering experience to analyze, research, develop, and troubleshoot issues. You will work in a high pace environment collaborating with senior engineers and Partner with business owners, development team, quality engineering resources, product owners, and project managers

Member of the Core team responsible for coding, testing, implementations, and troubleshooting
Engage and coordinate with multiple software vendors and ensure quality of code being development and delivered to Mastercard meets the agreed upon requirements.

Participate in complex project implementation activities
Ensure knowledge transfer of vendor technology to Mastercard staff.

Support collection and reporting of project and software metrics.
Work in a scrum team and support the implementation off all Agile methodology steps.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Advanced knowledge and understanding of Software Engineering Concepts including Waterfall and Agile Methodologies is required
Demonstrate MC Core Competencies
Comprehensive experience with the following: SDLC, Life Cycle Testing, Linux, Chef, Java Full Development stack, Windows, Linux, File Transfer Protocols

Job Title
Lead Software Development Engineer (Data team)
Overview

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. MasterCard Data & Services enables customers across industries and geographies to make smarter decisions and reach better outcomes with a tailored portfolio of solutions beyond the transaction.

Lead Software Development Engineering in Data & Services
As a Lead Software Development Engineer on the Data & Services Technologies team, you’ll hold a valued role within a rapidly growing and successful business unit, working closely with experienced and driven senior engineers to solve problems as a team. Innovative product opportunities, modern business questions, and intricate datasets present uniquely challenging problems that we are eager to take on. The Mastercard D&S next-generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies to face these problems. We are looking for an innovative software engineer who can play a leading role in helping us scale our platform development and tackle the big challenges of the future.

As a member of the Mastercard Intelligence team, you will bring your technical knowledge and full-stack development skills to build, deploy, and scale real-time interactive applications for thousands of clients across the globe. The team supports a data platform that leverages the Mastercard data along with 3rd party and client data to track performance and identify underperforming groups of customers. Our next-generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies. You will play a vital role within a rapidly growing team, working closely with experienced and driven engineers, to solve these challenging problems.

Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to feature design, building, and testing. The range of work you encounter varies from front-end web development to writing server-side calculation code to database work. There are no rigid organizational structures at Mastercard; each team uses processes that work the best for that team's members and projects.

Job Title
Software Engineer II
Position Overview

As a Software Development Engineer on the Platforms team, you’ll hold a valued role within a rapidly growing and successful firm, working closely with experienced and driven senior engineers to solve problems as a team. Innovative product opportunities, modern business questions, and intricate datasets present uniquely challenging problems that we are eager to take on. Mastercard D&S next generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies to face these problems. Our software is required to effectively decipher analytically complex insights from these problems, on which businesses base multi-million dollar business decisions.

As a member of the Test & Learn team, you will apply your full-stack development skills to building industry-leading business experimentation software that brings sophisticated analytic techniques to business users around the world. We are rapidly expanding our product offerings and innovating on how we deliver Test & Learn solutions to our clients. We are looking for an innovative software engineer who can play a role in helping us scale our platform development and tackle the big challenges of the future. This individual will contribute to feature development in the Test & Learn product suite across our technology stack, with a close link to the value we provide to our customers.

Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to designing, building, and testing features. The range of work you encounter varies from designing highly-performant data processing at scale to building world-class analytics to creating great user interfaces and beyond. There are no rigid organizational structures, and each team uses processes that work the best for that team members and projects.

Join a fast growing team!

What is Data & Services?

The Data & Services Team (D&S) is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. We combine traditional management consulting with our rich data assets and in-house technology to provide our clients with powerful insights and tools to drive fact-based decision making. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, our services include consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, test-and-learn business experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management. While specializing in the payments industry, Mastercard Data & Services also works closely with major retailers, airlines, and other enterprises, leveraging data and insights garnered from within and beyond its network.

We are looking for passionate and talented technologists, who share our vision for empowering our customers to make better fact-based decisions, to join us and shape the growth of our team.

Who is Mastercard?

Mastercard is the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, and a technology innovation lab. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you.

Position Responsibilities:

As a part of Data & Services, you will build revolutionary products that advance how businesses all over the world seize the most value from their data. As a Software Development Engineer II within Test & Learn, you will:

Enhance a suite of web applications aimed to bring data decision making process to our clients and make valuable improvements to the capability of our products
Build features used by some of the world's largest organizations to make multi-million dollar decisions
Lead and push the boundaries of analytics and powerful, scalable applications
Collaborate across teams with exceptional peers who are passionate about what they do
Ideal Candidate Qualifications:

Full stack engineering experience in an agile production environment
Proficiency with advanced object-oriented programming, microservice development, and databases
Deep understanding of one or more programming languages/technology stacks (our tech stack is mostly .NET, Typescript/React, and SQL)
Passion for analytical / quantitative problem solving
Motivation, creativity, self-direction, and desire to thrive on small project teams
Superior academic record with a degree in Computer Science or related technical field
Strong written and verbal English communication skills

The Identity Verification group within the Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (C&I) division works to prevent fraud by securing a user’s identity through their devices, identity information, and usage patterns such as passive Biometrics. Comprised of best-in-class solutions from Ekata and NuData Security (Mastercard companies), we use complex machine learning, a client customizable rule engine, combined with device, identity, and transaction information from billions of transactions to reduce user friction to enable highly secure real time transactions.

The Identity Verification group is looking for a Sr Software Engineer in Test for the backend to help build out both customer facing and backend API products. Products such as for Account Protection and our internal ‘Identity Insights Network’ API which is creating a central, consumable way of combining Mastercard’s Identity Verification solutions for consumption.

Our team within Mastercard:
The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that are used by some of the world's largest organizations to make multi-million dollar decisions and grow their businesses. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services.
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Data & Services Technology team, you’ll hold a valued role within a rapidly growing and successful firm, working closely with experienced and driven senior engineers and mentoring junior engineers to solve problems as a team. Innovative product opportunities, modern business questions, and intricate datasets present uniquely challenging problems that we are eager to take on. Mastercard's D&S next generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies to face these problems. Our software is required to effectively decipher analytically complex insights from these problems, on which businesses base multi-million dollar business decisions.
As a member of the SpendingPulse team, you will bring your full-stack development skills to design, build, deploy, and scale the SpendingPulse application to provide economic insights across geographies and sectors to our customers. We work with cutting-edge web technologies and analyze large datasets using Big Data technologies within a Hadoop ecosystem to create a scalable, high-performance platform. We are looking for an innovative software engineer who can contribute to designing and building large features, and thrive in a fast-paced, agile team. This individual will be part of a large, cross-functional team and collaborate closely with our Customer Experience, Product Management, and Data Engineering & Analytics teams.
As part of our team, you will bring your full-stack development skills to design, build, test, deploy, and scale transformational new platforms for customers, including issuers, merchants, and governments, by leveraging large data sets, and providing actionable insights. We are looking for an innovative software engineer who will play a leading role in the design and build of a full stack web application and thrive in a fast-paced, agile team. This individual will help mentor junior engineers and be a key owner of many development processes and features the team is working on. This individual will partner closely with other areas of the business to build a solution that drives value for our customers.
Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to designing, building, and testing features. The range of work you encounter varies from building intuitive, responsive UIs to designing backend data models, and beyond. There are no rigid organizational structures, and each team uses processes that work best for its members and projects.
The SpendingPulse team is currently working on scaling the product globally and designing and building out the infrastructure that will facilitate the quality control and distribution of SpendingPulse results to consumers through various channels. As the product continues to expand globally, the team will add support for additional analytics, continue to automate manual processes and increase the robustness of the platform, and reduce the lag between a transaction occurring and insights being available in SpendingPulse.
Join a fast growing team!

Why is Mastercard for you?

Mastercard designs and builds the critical systems that power global commerce and connect billions of people everywhere to the vital goods and services they need every day. We are building a future that extends well beyond payments technology with cutting-edge products and services that solve hard and exciting challenges, across payments, open banking, cryptocurrencies, digital identity, large-scale data analysis and cyber security. Our technology builds trust and supports more than 300 million transactions every day across 210 countries and territories.

When you join Mastercard, you will work towards bringing more people everywhere into the digital economy: There can be no “left behind” and no “hard to reach”. Our teams are brought together by our common purpose and commitment to quality and innovation at scale. You will work side by side with leadership to overcome challenges together. Mastercard cultivates a culture of inclusion for all employees that values their individual strengths, views, and experiences. You can choose for yourself whether you want to become an expert, grow as a people manager, explore global markets, or learn entirely new skills.

Technology Strategy and Transformation (TST)

The Technology Strategy and Transformation (TST) team is responsible for defining the Mastercard Technology strategy and driving the program management to deliver it. In addition, the team drives at scale continues improvement across Technology with a focus on “ways of working”, tooling and technology upgrades, telemetry, and financial transparency as well as advanced analytics and AI.

We are looking for passionate people, that want to help ‘connect the dots’ to shape the future of Mastercard as we lead through Technology. Job Title
Technical Program Manager Analyst I
The RiskPS BizOps team is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who can help us solve problems, implement automation, and leverage best practices.

Business Operations is leading the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Mission

The role of business operations is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services. A business operations engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every biz ops team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process, and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience and increase the overall value of supported applications. Biz Ops teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of biz ops is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective, but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.

Experience in a financial environment preferred.

Job Title
Principal Technical Program Manager
Mastercard’s Technology Risk Management team is looking for a Technical Program Manager to help drive projects in the Security Compliance and Standards organization to meet customer and regulatory obligations. Focus would be around providing program management support and reporting of the on-going operating effectiveness of Mastercard’s internal control environment. Mastercard is committed to balancing innovation while protecting the internal control posture. The team assesses internal controls to proactively identify risks, define remediation actions and track remediation efforts. We are looking for someone to join our team and help us effectively manage these compliance goals and identify synergies across the team. This person will be a technically savvy person who likes to solve issues and drive outcomes.

Responsibilities:
 Engage with compliance team to develop project management activities to ensure effective delivery of projects. This includes tracking via appropriate tools/channels, developing appropriate cadence of stand-ups, and effective reporting.
 Support the development of new processes to ensure scalability and sustainability of the control programs
 Help ensure security risks and gaps as related to or identified by control frameworks (PCI, ISO, etc.) are effectively communicated to stakeholders and remediated in accordance with timelines identified
 Establish and track remediation internally and externally through to resolution
 Develop and manage risk processes, including identifying and implementing best practices and ensuring all processes are documented, reviewed, and updated regularly
 Manage internal control inquiries from both internal and external stakeholders

About You:
 Advanced knowledge and demonstrated expertise in the areas of planning and project delivery.
 Very flexible and with a strong ability to see what needs done, take ownership and act on it without detailed supervision.
 Experience with agile development and work management tools a plus
 Experience with compliance frameworks a plus
 Strong leadership, relationship-building and negotiation skills required with a solid track record for developing internal and external relationships.
 Highly skilled oral and written communications skills and be effective in interpersonal communications across all channels and levels.
 Ability to influence business partners and other stakeholders to drive intended outcomes.
 Highly organized and able to manage multiple projects at the same time.
 Experience with the payment card industry, risk management and corporate security a plus.In the US, Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. OVERVIEW

Are you a technologist who want to move into program management at a company that offers above and beyond benefits including paid parental leave, flexible work hours, gift matching, and even volunteer incentives? Do you want to work in an inclusive and nurturing culture that encourages your own professional learning and development?

At Mastercard, our industry expertise is enhanced by our commitment to being a force for good in the world. We do well by doing good. In this position, you'll be the "glue" across several engineering teams spanning both front-end, calculation, and data infrastructure code. The Intelligence Center suite of products is used by issuing and acquiring banks around the world to understand their data, and we are building continuous improvements in our features, performance, and quality.

ROLE

We are looking for new or aspiring technical program management professionals to join our team and help us build towards the future. Our Technical Program Managers (TPM) conceptualize, rationalize, and drive multiple simultaneous projects to deliver engineering work across the portfolio in our scrum execution model. In this role, you get to dive as deep as you want into the tech stack, the integration patterns, the organizational capabilities, and the company wide assets that can be leveraged to provide technical solutions to customer problems. You will contribute to the strategies, design choices, and even the cloud infrastructure necessary to build comprehensive believable and achievable execution plans to deliver high-profile new features and capabilities for our customers. You may drive the execution of a feature through the full stack or may drive a project which spans multiple teams and integrations, reporting meaningful status along the way.

We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better business results.

Overview:
The Identity Verification group within the Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (C&I) division works to prevent fraud by securing a user’s identity through their devices, identity information, and usage patterns such as passive Biometrics. Comprised of best-in-class solutions from Ekata and NuData Security (Mastercard companies), we use complex machine learning, a client customizable rule engine, combined with device, identity, and transaction information from billions of transactions to reduce user friction to enable highly secure real time transactions.

The Identity Verification group is building backend APIs that include both customer facing and internal. APIs such as for Account Protection and our internal ‘Identity Insights Network’ API which is creating a central, consumable way of combining Mastercard’s Identity Verification solutions.

We are looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager to work in our Agile environment to coordinate these projects and their deliverables between our scrum teams, Product Management, and a large array of stakeholders and dependencies within the various divisions of Mastercard. Strong communication and cross-team coordination at a project and technical level are desired.

Job Title
Technical Program Manager
Technical Program Manager
We are looking for a technical program management professional to join our team and help us build towards the future. Our Technical Program Manager (TPM) conceptualize, rationalize, and drive multiple simultaneous projects to deliver engineering work across the portfolio in our scrum execution model. In this role, you get to dive as deep as you want into the tech stack, the integration patterns, the organizational capabilities, and the company-wide assets that can be leveraged to provide technical solutions to customer problems. You will contribute to the strategies, design choices, and even the cloud infrastructure necessary to build comprehensive, believable, and achievable execution plans to deliver high-profile new features and capabilities for our customers. You may drive the execution of a feature through the full stack or may drive a project which spans multiple teams and integrations, reporting meaningful status along the way.

All About You
Demonstrated ability to operate with independence and autonomy
Experience defining and building cloud-native software products as a platform at scale with a deep understanding of those platforms' capabilities and underlying technologies
Demonstrated experience breaking down problems, organizing work, planning sprints, and delivering technical programs in agile delivery models (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Experience working on programs to define and build cloud-native software products as a platform at scale
Enjoys diving deep to understand the platforms' capabilities and underlying technologies
Proven track record of data-driven decision-making and applying continuous improvement methodologies across teams
Can debate the delivery strategy with business teams, architects, engineers, and designers
Can communicate to executives, peers, and staff with impact, eloquence, and authenticity
Demonstrated experience building relationships, partnering with and influencing dependent teams while commanding the respect of the individuals you work with across the organization
Huge plus if you have expertise in Payments, IaaS, PaaS, serverless technology, CI/CD, NoSQL databases, microservices APIs, and distributed systems operations in a DevOps model
BS in engineering, computer science, or related discipline

Job Title
Program Manager, Technology Strategy & Transformation - Mastercard Launch 2023
Why is Mastercard for you?

Mastercard designs and builds the critical systems that power global commerce and connect billions of people everywhere to the vital goods and services they need every day. We are building a future that extends well beyond payments technology with cutting-edge products and services that solve hard and exciting challenges, across payments, open banking, cryptocurrencies, digital identity, large-scale data analysis and cyber security. Our technology builds trust and supports more than 300 million transactions every day across 210 countries and territories.

When you join Mastercard, you will work towards bringing more people everywhere into the digital economy: There can be no “left behind” and no “hard to reach”. Our teams are brought together by our common purpose and commitment to quality and innovation at scale. You will work side by side with leadership to overcome challenges together. Mastercard cultivates a culture of inclusion for all employees that values their individual strengths, views, and experiences. Follow your own path, with the flexibility to move between roles, teams and our global tech hubs. You can choose for yourself whether you want to become an expert, grow as a people manager, explore global markets, or learn entirely new skills.

Technology Strategy and Transformation (TST)

The Technology Strategy and Transformation (TST) team is responsible for defining the Mastercard Technology strategy and driving the program management to deliver it. In addition, the team drives at scale continues improvement across Technology with a focus on “ways of working”, tooling and technology upgrades, telemetry, and financial transparency as well as advanced analytics and AI.

We are looking for passionate people, that want to help ‘connect the dots’ to shape the future of Mastercard as we lead through Technology. We are committed finding the best people for the job and enabling them to do their best work (e.g., hybrid working practices, role specific learning and development and mentorship). Join a rapidly growing team that is shaping what the next decade of Mastercard Technology will look like, and help us drive the execution of our core objectives:

Overview

Transactis, a Mastercard company, works with banks and their merchants to transform traditional paper-based billing and payments to smarter electronic transactions that are more efficient, cost-effective and environmentally friendly. Since 2007, Transactis has been a leading provider of Electronic Bill Presentment and Payment (EBPP) solutions to businesses of all sizes.

As the Customer Technical Services Analyst I you will be responsible for providing first line customer support to all our clients via phone and e-mail, troubleshoot issues, handle informational requests and deliver well designed and documented solutions to our customers in a timely manner. Our clients contact us for assistance with various topics such as utilization of new or existing system functionality, resolution of system bugs or performance issues reported by end users, requests for changes to the platform, and assistance with customer communication. In this role, we will rely on you to be knowledgeable about our complete solution and provide resolution, consultation and education to users that represent the best practices for utilizing the EBPP platform. We expect our Technical Services Analysts to pursue the highest levels of customer satisfaction and create the experience that reflects our goal of being “easy to do business with.”

Job Title
Security Monitoring and Response Analyst II
Who is Mastercard?

Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.

Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview

The Security Operations Defense and Automation (SODA) team is looking for a Security Monitoring and Response Analyst to support and drive maturity of network security products as well as contribute to supporting the remainder of the SODA security tool portfolio. The ideal candidate is passionate about securing Mastercard, highly motivated, intellectually curious, analytical, and possesses an entrepreneurial mindset. The role requires a blend of cybersecurity experience and communication skills in order to protect Mastercard assets and provide support for Mastercard associates.

Role

In this highly visible position, you will:

Lead the design, implementation, and enforcement of security policies that protect systems and data from access by unauthorized users

Assess security risks, recommend, and implement improvements within the SODA toolset to reduce vulnerability

Implement signatures and settings for detection, identification, and reporting of possible cyber-attacks/intrusions, anomalous activities, and misuse activities

Guide security solutions that meet security monitoring and response standards

Work closely with the Security Operations Center and other Mastercard teams to deploy secure configurations based on current threats

Provide engineering-level troubleshooting in the case of user or company impact

All About You

Essential requirements of candidates:

Strong working knowledge of network security technologies (Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems, Web Proxy, eMail Antivirus, network malware detection, etc.)

Strong understanding of TCP/IP, Mitre ATT&CK, Kill Chain, Vulnerability Management and Networking principles

Experience with Windows, Unix Based Operating Systems, and Cloud Security fundementals

Strong problem-solving skills to effectively research investigate and offer solutions to issues that are more complex and difficult in nature

Ability to work effectively in ambiguous and/or high-pressure situations

Be skilled at explaining technical problems succinctly and clearly

Be a strong, confident, and exacting writer and speaker, able to communicate your vision and roadmap effectively to a wide variety of stakeholders

Previous Security Operations Center experience a plus

All About Us

The Client Service team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. We combine traditional management consulting with our rich data assets and in-house technology to provide our clients with powerful strategic insights and recommendations. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, test-and-learn business experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. While specializing in the payments industry, Mastercard Client Services also works closely with major retailers, airlines, and other enterprises, leveraging data and insights garnered from within and beyond its network.

All About the Role

Make an Impact as an Analyst, Advisors Deploy Program Management

Advisors Deploy Program Management is an execution-oriented client facing competency that applies proven, accredited change skills and domain experience to partner with clients and help them drive measurable value by:


Deploy is a new suite of consulting solutions designed to respond to fast evolving customer needs for execution support, with a dual mission: deployment and value realization over the entire lifetime of major assets. Value realization is a complex task, and with Deploy we can de-risk the entire client/asset journey, from implementation to adoption, usage, and product evolution. This is done through a set of new capabilities focused on expert execution support, that we are bringing in to complement the traditional Advisors areas of strength.

As an Analyst you will be managing the implementation and execution of Mastercard analytic tools to support the Client’s B2B payment optimization efforts. This Analyst will be supporting the Client with delivering multiple projects workstreams leveraging Mastercard assets, providing efficient and effective coordination of a complex range of activities by clearly defining scope, project timelines, and stakeholder roles and responsibilities that are aligned with the delivery of the expected benefits. You will also ensure effective identification of risks and pro-active solutioning to mitigate risks and impact on timelines.

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Manager, Innovation Communications
Manager, Innovation Communications

Company

Mastercard is the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. The company is a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. Mastercard ensures every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. The company believes in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

Summary

The Communications team is focused on driving programs and activities that evolve, promote and protect Mastercard’s reputation among key internal and external audiences. The broader team has been designed to closely mirror the business, align to corporate and business-level objectives and support the company’s efforts in delivering world-class payments experiences.

The Manager of External Communications within the Global Product & Engineering organization will be focused on developing strategic communications programs and campaigns to advance Mastercard’s reputation as a trusted, purpose-driven innovator. The role will be responsible for elevating the company’s innovation position, reputation and brand perception with key external stakeholders including media, customers, prospects, and more.

In addition, the Manager will lead the development of product innovation editorial content, advancing the digital presence of senior business leaders including Mastercard’s Chief Innovation Officer, and crafting internal communications to support the innovation story-telling program.

Responsibilities

Work in collaboration with the Senior Vice President, Communications for P&E and other senior business and marcomm leaders to develop progressive, integrated communications and marketing strategies to advance the company’s mission, and evolve, promote and protect Mastercard’s brand and reputation

Qualifications

You are a motivated, curious, critical thinker, with an affinity for technology, comfortable debating the potential it has to positively impact individuals, businesses, governments and economies. You are a clear, strategic writer, capable of distilling complex arguments and propositions into accessible and compelling narratives. And you are a passionate PR leader and digital expert motivated by metrics-led success and a true partnership with the business.



NYC Salary Range: $122,000 - $190,000

Job Title
Senior Systems Platform Engineer
Job Overview:
Assist and oversee day-to-day support activities for IT services, such as Apple and WinTel client application technologies. Other technology support areas could include Windows client and server operating systems, various core and non-core software applications, messaging/collaboration software’s or services and physical device hardware or software installations, upgrades, and maintenance activities. Design, lead and support departmental projects. Manage to financial and resource estimates. Provide input on technology directions and process or cost improvement efforts.
Major Accountabilities:
Lead project’s and maintenance task’s relating to MacOS and Windows Operating Systems within a corporate environment.
Tier-3 PC & Apple hardware & software with experience supporting both platforms with a Microsoft infrastructure
Develop technical resources and provide training to support teams on MacOS topics; including but not limited to: Terminal operations, Recovery mode and Safe boot features, Kernel panic troubleshooting resolution, FileVault, Keychain Access and Management, configuration profiles, Network troubleshooting, MDM (JAMF) administration and troubleshooting.
Develop technical resources and provide training to support teams through process improvement and guidance on product delivery and support of MacOS and Windows environments. Ensuring the ongoing growth and stability of the environment through continued improvement of these resources and training tools.
Identify and address emerging support trends, through root cause analyses and corrective action. Using reporting tools and technical partnerships within the business to address emerging trends. Partnering and communicating with a wide and diverse set of business groups through collaborative effort.
Lead and deliver ongoing regular training and knowledge transfer initiatives with all technical support staff ensuring the highest level of service for all end users. With a focus on customer service and fast resolution practices.
Education:
Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree with emphasis on information technologies or the equivalent job related experience.
Knowledge / Experience:
A high level of understanding and broad knowledge of computer technology and problem resolution procedures is required.
Proven experience with project management principles and execution is preferred.
Apple and Windows client/server software experience or technical certifications preferred.
Project management, large project support execution or team leadership experiences preferred.
Extensive Helpdesk or customer contact skills or experience preferred.
Skills/ Abilities:
Professionalism and good work ethic skills are required.
Customer support and communications skills are required.
Ability to compose, direct others in and follow documented processes and procedures is required.
Work Conditions:
General office environment.
Remote as well as office work expected.
Possible shift work.

Job Title
Lead Software Engineer - Data Platform
The Data Platform team builds scalable, easy-to-use services and frameworks that provide the foundation for many of Mastercard's customer-facing applications. We work closely with market-facing product engineering teams to help them take maximum advantage of these capabilities and to evolve our platform to meet their needs and the needs of our customers. You will work with a multidiscipline team to design and implement a data platform, revolutionizing how Mastercard can realize value from its extensive data asset pool.

As a Lead Software Engineer in Data & Services, you will have the opportunity to build high-performance platforms that advance how businesses all over the world unleash the most value from their data. You will play a vital role within a rapidly growing organization, while working closely with experienced and driven engineers to solve challenging problems.

Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to designing, building, and testing features. There are no rigid organizational structures, and each team uses processes that work the best for that team members and projects.

What is Data & Services?

The Data & Services Team (D&S) is a key differentiator for Mastercard. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. We combine our rich data assets and in-house technology to provide our clients with powerful insights and tools to drive fact-based decision making. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, our services include economic modeling, smart loyalty and marketing programs, test-and-learn business experimentation, and data-driven information/risk management. While specializing in the payments industry, Mastercard Data & Services also works closely with major retailers, airlines, and other enterprises, leveraging data and insights garnered from within and beyond its network.

We are looking for passionate and talented technologists, who share our vision for empowering our customers to make better fact-based decisions, to join us and shape the growth of our team.

Who is Mastercard?

Mastercard is the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, and a technology innovation lab. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you.

Job Title
Senior Systems Platform Engineer
Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

Overview
The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services.

Mastercard’s Data & Services Infrastructure Delivery team is responsible for the deployment, configuration, maintenance, backup and support of multiple on-premise and cloud hosted data centers. In this role, you will be given the ownership and resources to solve challenging technical problems. Our Systems Engineers have the opportunity to build a long-term and exciting career in a dynamic technology oriented and rapidly growing organization.

Are you an experienced information technologist who is excited by…

Automating routine tasks and making systems more efficient?
Being part of an innovative, technologically advanced team?
Learning about new and staying on the cutting-edge of technology?
Working through challenging technical problems of deploying additional environments in new datacenters as we scale globally?

Role

Procuring, installing, managing, and monitoring physical and virtual infrastructure in both local and remote geographies
Automating commonly performed tasks, using scripting tools such as Powershell, Ansible, and Python
Experience managing and deploying large scale multi-forest Active Directory architecture
Supporting multi-geography, multi-cloud deployments across the Azure, AWS, and GCP
Familiarity supporting virtualization platforms Hyper-V, VMware, and KVM
Work with internal stakeholders to provision, provide access, and troubleshoot various testing and production resources
Manage backup and recovery operations for multiple data centers across geography, backing up multiple petabytes of data weekly
Documenting commonly encountered issues and creating documentation on newly implemented systems on various Atlassian products
Participate in on call rotations, responding to after-hours incidents in a timely manner

About You

Experience with Microsoft Enterprise Products (Active Directory, Windows Server. SQL Server, etc)
Strong desire and prior experience automating common tasks
Ability to solve complex problems independently and in a team setting
Competency using industry standard automation/scripting languages (e.g. Powershell, SQL, Python)
Experience with cloud technology such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud
Experience deploying and supporting VMWare at an enterprise level
Experience with Terraform, or Ansible
Background on cloud native tooling and orcestration technologies (Kubernetes)
Ability to juggle competing tasks and prioritize
Proven ability to communicate with team members effectively
Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills
Understanding of working in an agile team environment
Proven ability to build trust and partnership with stakeholders

Job Title

Job Title:

Lead Software Engineer, Priceless Platform

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships, and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview
The Priceless Platform is Mastercard’s B2B2C platform providing a range of experiences, benefits, and others for banks globally, who in turn provide these to their customers. Built by a startup and acquired by Mastercard, we continue to operate at high velocity, and drive impact. We are seeing significant expansion of our portfolio and operating in over twenty countries. We expose APIs that issuers and merchants use to integrate within their product portfolio on their own platforms, creating a thriving ecosystem.

The Role
We are seeking an experienced and highly proficient Lead Software Engineer to work within the Priceless Platform Engineering team, and provide technical leadership expertise for designing, developing, testing, deploying, and documenting services. Your job will be to work cross-functionally with Product and Go-To-Market organizations, and collaboratively with other software engineering team members to create and help them speed up their time to value.
You will raise the bar on technical excellence, show thought leadership, demonstrate execution excellence, and communicate well with different audiences. This role can be based in the Mastercard San Francisco office, or anywhere in the United States.

Job Title
BizOps Engineer II - SQL, Linux, Java
"Decision Management Platform's BizOps team is looking for an Operations Engineer who can help us solve problems and mitigate impacts and issues to our customers with top priority.

Business Operations is leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Mission

The role of business operations is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services. A business operations engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every biz ops team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process, and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience, and increase the overall value of supported applications. Biz Ops teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of biz ops is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective, but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.

Job Title
Senior Software Engineer (Build, Test Automation, CI/CD), Priceless Platform
Job Title:

Senior Software Engineer (Build, Test Automation, CI/CD), Priceless Platform

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships, and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview
The Priceless Platform is Mastercard’s B2B2C platform providing a range of experiences, benefits, and others for banks globally, who in turn provide these to their customers. Built by a startup and acquired by Mastercard, we continue to operate at high velocity, and drive impact. We are seeing significant expansion of our portfolio and operating in over twenty countries. We expose APIs that issuers and merchants use to integrate within their product portfolio on their own platforms, creating a thriving ecosystem.

The Role

We are looking for a passionate, highly proficient full stack Senior Software Engineer to work within the Priceless Platform Engineering team and help accelerate buildout of the next generation of the Priceless Platform. We are looking for someone who can bring innovative ideas to improving the developer velocity and developer experience. In this role, you will work on multiple projects critical to automating our build, product testing, and developing our CI/CD pipeline.

You are someone who works well in a cohesive team-oriented group of developers. You have a passion and ability for developing excellent test automation, build systems, and CI/CD pipelines, working in the public cloud and in regulated industries. You enjoy problem solving in a fast-paced environment and have a desire to take you career to the next level. If this opportunity excites you, we would love to talk.

This role can be based in the Mastercard San Francisco office, or anywhere in the United States.

VP - Blockchain Software Engineering
Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.

Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
Overview
Mastercard is looking for a talented Software Engineering VP to join the Mastercard Blockchain and Digital Asset Engineering team in our New York City or any US location. In this role you will be a leading a highly agile team building exiting and innovative products delivered at scale to global markets.

Our team is built on a foundation of research and development, mining innovation internally, innovating new product lines with emerging technology, managing new products from inception to market validation and engaging strategically with startups to shape the future of commerce with and for our customers. At Mastercard you will help define the future of commerce globally.

This team will have a diverse focus both in terms of geography and variety of technology challenges driving hard to bring innovative payment solutions to market.
Role & Responsibilities

Responsibilities will be wide-ranging for the right individual, providing the opportunity to make real global impact for the company & business. Responsibilities would in 3 broad area :

Consulting
o Driving the overall solution definition, documentation & securing approval by partnering with product team and our customers
o Working with Blockchain leadership team, Labs portfolio team & the blockchain development team, lead specific use case development on Mastercard Blockchain
o Partner with internal & external product team creating solutions primarily in the Cross Border B2B space. Knowledge of Corporate/Wholesale Banking domain is preferred
Delivery
o Partnering with customer and product team to define the requirement and implementation of the same using Agile Development methodology
o Responsible for working with customers & internal stakeholders in executing the delivery that includes development, E2E testing with customers, helping customers understand the blockchain principles, design, certification of the solution and deployment into the live environment for execution of market test
o Driving successful execution of the market test, launch and transition

Technology Architecture & Thought leadership
o Thought leader in the blockchain space to drive new innovation from defining new networks on blockchain, inter-operability, quantum computing & its impact and in general decentralization
o Lead new proof of concepts that builds upon blockchain and other relevant technologies to create a comprehensive use case that solves for business problem
o Act as software architect for the project/initiatives assigned and be the technology leader representing engineering from architecture and delivery perspective.

Lead Middleware Engineer
Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
