Overview:
Infrastructure Design Architects is a team of Technology Architects and Engineers responsible for the analysis and design of the infrastructure framework to fit the application, platform or system needs in-line with operational standards and principles.
This job requires experience and knowledge in internet fundamentals related to web servers, application servers, Networking, DataBase, Disaster Recovery, internet security and other internet technologies.

Role:
Infrastructure Design Services is engaged from the beginning of the analysis and design phase to work with the application team(s) and other critical teams within Mastercard to ensure that the completed infrastructure and application architecture aligns with MasterCard’s security, scalability and availability standards.
Infrastructure Design Services' primary deliverable is the TAD (Technical Architecture Document) which details the infrastructure design for the application, platform or system.
Responsible for the delivery of the Technical Architecture Document(TAD) to meet the requirements of the Application Team's Solution & their SLA.
Support the resolution of problems impacting infrastructure or product availability and performance globally.
Partner with BizOps and Application teams to support the PCI documents and external/internal audits.
Guide and train the Engineers and junior architects.
Engage in collaborative exercises and discussions with Solution Architects, Web Platform Engineers and other Shared Services Engineers to Implement, manage and support internet infrastructure components.
Research alternative technical solutions for changing business needs.

Required Skills/All About You:
Advanced knowledge of middleware infrastructure technologies (Apache, Jboss, WebSphere, Tomcat, F5, ISAM) and infrastructure fundamentals related to Data Bases, Servers, Data Center, Disaster Recovery and Security.
Ability to establish relationships and partnerships with application development teams and internally within Operations.
Strong coaching and written/oral communication skills.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and react to emergency challenges without disrupting team dynamics.
Understanding of Scaled Agile.
Ability to understand technical conversations and communicate technically with other teams.
Strong strategic mindset with the ability to transform Mastercard’s operational approach to supporting service delivery teams and build applications with operations in mind.
Knowledge of automation, CI/CD, and cloud-based technologies.
Provide technical leadership and participate in evaluating new technology for Mastercard.
Ability to conduct difficult conversations both internally within the team and externally with service delivery teams.
Ability to multi-task.

Job Title
Software Engineer II - Deployment Platform
Who is Mastercard?

We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

Data & Services within Mastercard

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include predictive analytics, data visualization and business intelligence software.

Software Engineer II - Site Reliability - Data & Services Technology Team

As a Software Engineer II - Site Reliability on the D&S Technology team, you’ll hold a valued role within a rapidly growing team inside one of the worlds most successful organizations, working closely with experienced and driven senior engineers to solve problems as a team. Mastercard D&S next generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies to face these problems. Our software is required to effectively decipher analytically complex insights from these problems, on which businesses base multi-million dollar business decisions.

As a member of the Software Delivery team, you will be responsible for building tools and systems that deploy and scale our applications and data in hybrid - cloud and physical - environments. We develop the infrastructure that enables the Data & Services Platforms team to build, test, deploy and host hundreds of microservices across several global datacenters. We also develop the logging, monitoring and vulnerability detection tools necessary for application developers to get insight into the security, quality and uptime of their code. Our systems are administered with infrastructure-as-code with our stack including Chef, Ansible and Terraform and our workflows are automated using Jenkins and Kubernetes

As our Technology Foundations team continues to grow, we are looking for engineers who are passionate about DevOps, infrastructure, security and release management tooling.

Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to designing, building, and testing features. There are no rigid organizational structures, and each team uses processes that work the best for that team members and projects.

Enjoy large scale DevOps challenges? Come solve them with us.

Job Title
BizOps Engineer II - SQL & Unix
Overview

The Data Platforms and Engineering Services (DPES) BizOps team is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who can help us solve problems, build our CI/CD pipeline and lead Mastercard in DevOps automation and best practices.

Business Operations is leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Role

The role of business operations is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services. A business operations engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every biz ops team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process, and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience, and increase the overall value of supported applications. Biz Ops teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of biz ops is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective, but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.

Overview
Mastercard award-winning Decision Management Platform (DMP) delivers industry leading intelligence with business agility at global scale to power products that protect our customers from fraud, impede crimes such as human trafficking and terrorism, provide customers control over their spend, protect Mastercard from financial risk, and earn significant revenue.
Processing over 1.5 billion transactions per day in tens of milliseconds each at over 65,000 transactions per second, DMP leverages innovative new technologies including multi-layered AI engines, real time feature stores leverage extreme performance in memory data grids, a streaming big data cluster, business intelligence tooling, self-service business rule capabilities, and web apps & API for providing customers control and insights for their decisions.

Job Title
Software Engineer I

Role
The Mastercard Decision Management Program has an exciting opportunity for strong, innovative Software Engineers to join our innovation team and develop the next generation of cloud-native high throughput, low latency AI-driven intelligent transaction processing services.
In this role, you will research new approaches to solving critical problem in the Payment decisioning space and validate them implementing Proof-of-Concepts leveraging event-driven and microservice architecture in an agile delivery process.
We are looking for engineers who can bring unique perspectives and innovative ideas to all areas of development and are interested in continuing to improve our platform through the ever-changing technology landscape.

Our software is required to effectively decipher analytically complex insights from these problems, on which businesses base multi-million dollar business decisions.
As a member of the Software Delivery team, you will be responsible for building tools and systems that deploy and scale our applications and data in hybrid - cloud and physical - environments. They develop the infrastructure that enables the Data & Services Platforms team to build, test, deploy and host hundreds of microservices across several global datacenters. We also develop the logging, monitoring and vulnerability detection tools necessary for application developers to get insight into the security, quality and uptime of their code. Job Title
BizOps Engineer II - SQL, Linux, Java
"Decision Management Platform's BizOps team is looking for an Operations Engineer who can help us solve problems and mitigate impacts and issues to our customers with top priority.

Business Operations is leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Mission

The role of business operations is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services. A business operations engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every biz ops team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process, and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience, and increase the overall value of supported applications. Biz Ops teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of biz ops is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective, but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.

Job Overview:
Assist and oversee day-to-day support activities for IT services, such as Apple and WinTel client application technologies. Other technology support areas could include Windows client and server operating systems, various core and non-core software applications, messaging/collaboration software’s or services and physical device hardware or software installations, upgrades, and maintenance activities. Lead project’s and maintenance task’s relating to MacOS and Windows Operating Systems within a corporate environment.

Lead and deliver ongoing regular training and knowledge transfer initiatives with all technical support staff ensuring the highest level of service for all end users. With a focus on customer service and fast resolution practices.

The SRC BizOps team is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who can help us solve problems, build our CI/CD pipeline and lead Mastercard in DevOps automation and best practices.

Business Operations is leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Mission

The role of business operations is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services. A business operations engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every biz ops team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process, and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience, and increase the overall value of supported applications. Biz Ops teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of biz ops is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective, but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.

Remote, Full Time
At ConsenSys, we have a vision of a world where data sovereignty and financial well-being is accessible to every person and organization. We believe Ethereum and decentralized protocol technology is a more trustworthy and equitable foundation for how we create and share value across the web. On this trusted, open source foundation, we can accelerate the world's transition to a universally accessible network of distributed participants where transparency, security and freedom are fundamental.
Our product suite, composed of Truffle, Infura, Quorum, Codefi, MetaMask, and Diligence, serves millions of users, supports billions of blockchain-based queries for our clients, and has handled billions of dollars in digital assets. As the leading Ethereum software company, ConsenSys enables developers, enterprises, and people worldwide to build next-generation applications, launch modern financial infrastructure, and access the decentralized web. To learn more about ConsenSys, and explore our products and solutions, visit http://consensys.net/.

OVERVIEW

Finicity, a Mastercard company, is seeking a VP of Product, Open Banking Analytics to deliver differentiated analytics solutions which support all Mastercard’s U.S. Open Banking use cases and client verticals. The objective will be to ideate, build and manage analytical solutions (e.g. predictive attributes and scores) to improve our clients’ decision-making and performance in Payments, Lending and Small Business. The analytics products themselves are cutting edge – fueled by Mastercard’s consumer-permissioned open banking data – and are key to driving differentiation to our services and ultimately a positive impact for our clients’ consumer and small business customers while meeting regulatory compliance, contractual agreements and best practices. This role will report to the SVP Analytics Products & Data Science.

The Analytics team is responsible for creating a full-suite of Smart Payment tools, delivering model-ready attributes, and enhancing and operationalizing services in categorization, entity and financial account data, verification solutions, and much more. As a successful product and practice leader, you will listen to clients and their end consumers to understand opportunities and challenges across all financial networks, open banking and FinTech related industries in the markets you serve. You’ll lead teams of product managers and product owners, as well as provide vision and guidance for data scientists, engineers and data analysts across teams. As a subject matter expert and lead for these data-driven products, you’ll be responsible for continuing to innovate and optimize processes.

Overall

We solve real world security challenges and mitigate threats for some of the largest technology, eCommerce, and financial institutions in the world, including members in the top 5 of the Fortune 500.

The Field Implementation Engineer works closely with our Sales and Customer Success teams to share technical and product knowledge throughout the sales cycle and bridge the gap between technology and business. Job Title
Senior Systems Platform Architect
Job Title:
Senior Systems Platform Architect
Overview:

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview
The Core Service Delivery team is looking for a candidate who can help us solve problems, plan and design the footprint of our systems, and lead Mastercard in definition of standards and best practices.

Infrastructure Design at Mastercard is a team of Technology Architects and Engineers responsible for the analysis and design of the infrastructure framework to fit the application, platform or system needs in-line with Mastercard's operational standards and principles. Our team is engaged from the beginning of the analysis and design phase to work with the application teams and other critical teams within Mastercard to ensure the completed infrastructure and application architecture aligns with Mastercard’s security, scalability, reliability, and availability standards.

Are you passionate about systems architecture, and ensuring the set of high-level requirements is consistent, complete, correct, and operationally defined?

Would you like to build mission critical middleware infrastructure?

Do you have a high degree of initiative and self-motivation and demonstrate the ability to drive results?

Are you passionate about delivering quality?

Then… we would love to hear from you!

Major Accountabilities for this role:

Responsible for gathering requirements, conducting infrastructural analysis, and producing robust designs that adhere to approved Mastercard technologies, and ensuring the design meets all Mastercard's technology and security policies.

Responsible for meeting with peers, engineers, application team(s) and user(s), to determine that all the high-level requirements have been met.

Responsible for generating products such as Infrastructure Design Artifacts, technical memos, logical flows, and models to keep the users, architects, and the engineers constantly up to date and in agreement on the architecture and infrastructure layout of an application, system, or platform.

Responsible for ensuring that all architectural products and products with architectural input are maintained in the most current state and never allowed to become obsolete.

Responsible for implementing, managing, and supporting application infrastructure components while leveraging current standards and best practices.

In charge of resolving internet architectural and operational problems impacting infrastructure & product availability and performance globally.

May contribute to the definition of new standards.

May contribute to researching and evaluating new technology for possible deployment in Mastercard’s internet infrastructure.

May contribute to ongoing regional projects as assigned; including responsibility for planning; time and cost control; resource utilization and implementation.

May contribute to incident/problem diagnosis and root cause analysis.

May provide input into performance tuning; capacity planning and configuration management for Mastercard components.

Assure system stability and future compatibility by monitoring production execution of all relevant systems.

Experiences

Gains exposure to systems architecture, new technologies, industry standards and best practices.

Participates in global technology initiatives for system and platform architecture

Gains exposure to business resource groups and global communities

Demonstrated initiative in building relationships with colleagues from multiple areas within Mastercard

Exposure to internal resources and tools

Education (preferred):

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Sciences, or Information Systems, or equivalent experience.

All About You

Advanced knowledge of Web application architecture and project delivery.

Intermediate knowledge of how the Java Virtual Machine works, how Garbage collection works.

Intermediate knowledge of load balancers and web application firewalls

Intermediate knowledge of network and operating system principles

Vast knowledge of middleware technologies (Web Servers, Application Servers, Queue Managers, Messaging, Caching)

Working knowledge of Database technologies.

Working knowledge of cloud technologies

Solid knowledge of techniques or methodologies to achieve non-functional requirements like reliability, availability, resilience, performance, security.

Working knowledge of Role Based Access Control, Authentication and Authorization mechanisms.

Proficient in root cause analysis and troubleshooting.

Skills/Abilities:

Detailed oriented and customer obsessed.

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Ability to multi-task and prioritize efforts.

Ability to pick up new technologies at a quick pace and learn on-the-go

Ability to work with team members located in multiple geographies

Displays excellent collaborative skills with cross-functional teams.

Job Title
Senior Devops Cloud Engineer
Overview:
The Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (C&I) team is responsible for product management and innovative product development of products and services to address the evolving risk & cyber security needs of all of MasterCard’s various customer segments. The C&I team was established with the responsibility to safeguard all aspects of safety and security in payments and have made great strides with new products, services and standards, positively impacting all aspects of our current and future payment eco-system.

Ekata, a Mastercard company, is the global standard in identity verification, providing businesses worldwide the ability to link any digital transaction to the human behind it. Our Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only of its kind, uses complex machine learning to combine features derived from the billions of transactions within our proprietary network and the data from our graph to deliver industry leading risk assessment solutions.

We're looking for an exceptional Senior Reliability Engineer to join our team, and work in an environment where you can fit the best technology to the challenge. As a member of the Ekata Infrastructure team you will work with top-notch engineers to design and implement best in class technology to solve problems.

The Site Reliability Engineer manages our production environment, providing a highly available and scalable platform for Ekata to serve our customers. The Infrastructure team provides a resource for Engineering to help diagnose production issues, and provide guidance on improving the availability and performance of our applications. This position also develops systems, automation and tools to help make it easier for Engineering teams to deploy services in a fast, automated and reliable fashion.

Job Title
Associate Product Specialist, Launch 2023
Mastercard is a global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

Make an Impact as an Associate Product Specialist

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent, to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months, Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit, learn and develop skills, and gain valuable on the job experience. As an Associate Product Specialist in Data & Services you will have the opportunity to experience two rotations over the duration of the program. These rotations will take place in two of the three following groups:

Global Loyalty Services
Global Loyalty Services helps customers drive their engagement and grow their business through loyalty program management, offers and Cardholder Services. Our world-class loyalty solutions enable Issuers and/or Merchants to reward, protect and assist cardholders driving overall brand usage, retention and brand preference. Our vision is to become the partner of choice for Issuers and Merchants by leveraging our solutions to drive profitable consumer engagement and Mastercard preference.

Marketing Services
Marketing Services acquires new consumers and increases engagement with existing consumers to drive business results for clients. We work with financial institutions, fintechs, merchants, digital players and governments to engage consumers at every stage of the marketing journey to drive better marketing outcomes leveraging a unique blend of global marketing expertise, data, analytics, technology, our network of preferred partners, and Mastercard brand assets. We are also a strategic force multiplier, accelerating adoption and use of Mastercard products and services, and driving incremental growth in our core business.

Insights & Analytics
Insights & Analytics leverages trusted data to empower organizations to make smarter decisions for better outcomes through insights portals and analytics tools and solutions. We partner with financial institutions, merchants, and public sector organizations, enabling them to understand their business and take actions. From executing best-in-class testing analytics, to understanding spend activity in a geography, to benchmarking overall payment performance and operations, I&A is the engine that enables Mastercard and our customers to create value from data.

Job Title
Senior Specialist, Product Management
Overview:
Mastercard Send is a global payment service that allows financial institutions, fintechs, digital customers and other businesses to send real-time payments to debit cards using push-payments technology. Mastercard Send’s use cases and applications include person-to-person (P2P) transfers, business to consumer (B2C) disbursements (e.g. insurance claim payment), acquirer to small-merchant (B2sm) disbursements, and more.
Mastercard Send is hiring a Senior Specialist, Product Management. As a key part of the Send Product Management team, this position is responsible for supporting the Products & Innovation team in North America by enabling and launching new use cases, supporting new business development, and developing robust Product Marketing & Communications campaigns to amplify Mastercard Send’s market position. Additionally, the Senior Specialist will develop fact-based insights and assessments/analyses, prepare customer-facing documents to support commercial activities and drive the Send product strategy to advance Mastercard’s digital agenda in the region.
This role requires working cross-functionally with other groups like account managers, business development specialist, US Product Delivery, global and regional product teams, Marketing & Communications, Franchise, Legal, and Finance, among others. The Senior Specialist is part of the Products & Innovation team in the North America Region; and a significant contributor to Mastercard’s strategy to capture new payment flows, win in digital and support growth in core business.

Job Title
Senior Specialist, Product Development
Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building an inclusive and sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
Overview
Digital First solutions enable our partners to provide entirely digital payment experiences for consumers, with a physical card option. By combining Mastercard products and services with qualified third-party partners, we support each step of the digital consumer journey all the way from acquisition and card usage to management, and engagement.

Payments are on the precipice of industry-wide change driven by consumer demands for immediacy and convenience, and digital first experiences are leading the way. 56% of consumers believe receiving and using digital cards instead of physical cards is a behavior that’s here to stay, and the pandemic has reinforced the need to meet consumers wherever they are. Mastercard’s Digital First Card Program, launched in 2019, continues to gain momentum as consumers seek out digitally-native, secure payments solutions.
Role
“Scaling Digital First Solutions” is a key strategic priority for Mastercard. By leveraging key partners across priority markets and customer segments, we can simplify implementation and drive scale more quickly. The Partnership Administrator role plays an important part in ensuring our partners are well informed, tracking to their KPIs and have the appropriate materials for sales and education.

Responsibilities include the creation and management of a partnership dashboard, the management of the global partnership pipeline (partner interactions, data gathering, data analysis etc.), working closely with Regional product teams and cross functional teams to ensure alignment on initiatives, supporting the commercialization of a number of new strategic partnerships (creating partner/Mastercard sales materials, creation and execution of a set of regional go-to-market plans) and engaging in competitive and partner capability research.

In addition, to help educate issuers globally on Digital First and our Digital First partners, create materials and organize educational webinars focused on partner digital first capabilities and a digital first partnerships product knowledge series.
All About You
You will have relevant experience in the payment industry, product management and/or product development, with experience in the consumer and digital payments space. You have a strong interest in digital payment solutions and initiatives and may have had recent involvement. You will have strong interpersonal and collaborative skills to develop relationships and partnerships with a broad range of individuals across the organization and externally.
Other key attributes:

As a product integrations expert, you will collaborate with our Account Managers, Partnership Managers, as well as customer technical architects and developers to design, test, document, and launch a solution that meets Ekata, partner, and customer needs.

CWS offers management expertise across the credit spectrum and supports both MasterCard and Visa accounts as well as a variety of private label debit, credit, stored value, and customer bankcards.

Quality Control Specialist, Billing Error Disputes Position Summary:
The Quality Control Specialist is responsible for reviewing Representments for Fraud and Non Fraud Disputes exception reports generated to provide oversight for business Operations objectives. The Quality Control Specialist will assess exception reports generated to identify and take corrective actions on occurrences that deviate from internal procedures, regulatory regulations and client requirements. Additional responsibilities of the role include reviewing completed Representments for Fraud and Non Fraud claims to ensure that quality standards are maintained in compliance with internal procedures and regulatory, industry and client requirements.

Consulting

o Working with Blockchain leadership team, Labs portfolio team & the blockchain development team, lead specific use case development on Mastercard Blockchain

o Partnering with customer and product team to define the requirement and implementation of the same using Agile Development methodology

o Act as software architect for the project/initiatives assigned and be the technology leader representing engineering from architecture and delivery perspective.

Role

Title: Data Engineer II
Job_Description:
Location: Remote
Type: Contract
W2 or 1099 candidates preferred
Our primary technology requirement is Advanced SQL. ETL development experience and knowledge of Cloud are definitely good to have. Besides that, a great candidate would be an excellent problem solver and self-starter with very good communication and time management skills.
Role description:
The Data Engineer will participate on data management aspects of client engagements to deliver Test & Learn and other D&S delivery solutions, as well as contribute to and foster a high-performance collaborative workplace. A Data Engineer II will:
- Work on Data Modeling associated with Data Engineering
- Independently execute projects through design, implementation, automation, and maintenance of large-scale enterprise ETL processes for a global client base
- Develop repeatable and scalable code that processes client data in an automated and efficient manner to ensure data availability in the platform is as real-time as possible.
- Act as an expert data resource within the team
- Manage the process of data delivery on teams by overseeing other Data Engineers and Analysts to deliver on-time, accurate, high-value, robust data solutions across multiple clients, solutions, and industry sectors
- Build trust-based working relationships with peers and clients across local and global teams
- Implement best practices and collaborate in the design of effective streamlined processes for a complex global solutions group
- Leverage industry best practices including proper use of source control, code reviews, data validation and testing
- Enhance big data pipelines using SQL, SSIS, Powershell and related technologies to address complex technical challenges and seamless communication with several cloud storage technologies
- Leverage new SQL Server features such as Columnstore Indexes, In-Memory OLTP, Incremental statistics, Trace Flags, SQL CLR functions, window aggregate functions, and parallel computing algorithms to reduce the processing time of multi-billion row data sets
- Contribute to the automation capabilities of the team. Implement techniques to optimize and routinize repeatable tasks for Test & Learn data setup
- Comply with and uphold all Mastercard internal policies and external regulations

Terms of Hire: Full Time.
Salary: $ Open K/ YR + Benefits.
Job Summary::

Job description:
Senior Software Architect - Payments domain
YOU ARE…:
Passionate about technology and see the world a little differently than your peers. Everywhere you look, there’s possibility. Opportunity. Boundaries to push and challenges to solve. You believe software engineering changes how people live.
At CLIENT, we believe that, too. We’re one of the world’s first tech companies, and still going strong. Like us, you know the online and mobile worlds better than any other—and see patterns that no one else sees. Our leadership team drives the delivery of products that provide optimal performance and stability with unsurpassed longevity with over 25 years in the Electronic Payments Industry.
We are looking for talented people to join our expanding our CLIENT Payment Solutions team. Our product as a cloud based SaaS solution is responsible for providing the foundation for CLIENT cloud-based payments.
Our primary customers are merchants you see and visit every day in the Retail, Grocery, and Hospitality industry. We experience the impact our work is having, and we take pride in providing services with great availability and ease of use.

CLIENT Payment Solutions is a completely secure payment solution delivering uncompromising data protection and future innovation readiness. It is the ideal answer to the rising risk of electronic transaction-related fraud and payment data security breaches. Implemented as a SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) solution, Payment Solutions offers a secure payment route and ensures complete data and transmission protection, from PIN pad to payment processor. Our Payments solutions allows retailers to easily comply with evolving payment regulations and standards, such as PCI DSS (Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard) and EMV (Europay, MasterCard and Visa), and offers them the freedom to work with any payment processor and peripheral vendor. Payment Solutions ultimately provides retailers with the innovation-ready architecture, reliability and centralized management they need to prepare for a future of new payment options that improve shopper experience. Check us out!




The CLIENT Architect acts as the responsible for guiding the CLIENT Payments Application Development team through the development process. Ensures development is being done right the first time and has an understanding of how their product relate with other products, and insures interdependencies are in focus. Similarly, the CLIENT Payments Architect acts as the lead Infrastructure Architect responsible for guiding the delivery and implementation of solutions with appropriate preparedness for CLIENT clients and customers in CLIENT strategic datacenters and cloud deployments. Success is measured on the ability to minimize re-work required after production implementation, which may be due to stability, performance, and/or functionality that does not support architectural tenets (e.g. digital first, services-oriented architecture, Software as a Service processing, etc.). Makes design decisions and technology recommendations to satisfy business requirements based on the product roadmap/vision. Continuously communicates the vision in an audience-appropriate manner, both internally and externally, from developers and designers to business owners and customers. Makes recommendations based upon this vision and associated analysis in order to satisfy tactical, operational, and strategic needs. Ensures lead engineers and designers are familiar with application, software and infrastructure technology assets, standards, and requirements along with software development best practices. Assists in the identification of patterns, techniques, tools, and processes that contribute to effective project execution and business-unit profitability.
The CLIENT Payments Architect contributes in the following:

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline; or equivalent combination of education and experience that is required for the specific job level. Post-graduate education is desired.

Job Title

Overview
Mastercard is committed to balancing innovation while protecting individual privacy and has embraced privacy and data protection as core to the successful execution of its business strategy. As part of that commitment Mastercard has established a world-class privacy program and is currently adding talent to its global team.
The Senior Counsel, Privacy & Data Protection will support both the strategy and the daily operations of the Privacy and Data Protection Team in the North American Market (NAM) region, while enabling business teams through Mastercard’s Privacy by Design approach and reinforcing Mastercard’s world leadership in responsible, data-driven innovation.
The position will report to the Senior Managing Counsel, Privacy & Data Protection will be a member of the Global Privacy & Data Protection team as well as a member of the Law & Policy team, and will operate out of our Global Headquarters in Purchase, NY.
Role
The Senior Counsel, Privacy & Data Protection will support the Privacy and Data Protection team to ensure privacy compliance is built into Mastercard data-driven products and services in NAM, with specific emphasis on the company’s Consumer Solutions offerings in digital payments, payments acceptance and processing, blockchain and cryptocurrency, and fintech engagement. The selected candidate must have the ability to understand complex privacy and data protection laws and the operational and technical requirements behind compliance with these laws. Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Overview

Finicity, a Mastercard company, is leading the Open Banking Initiative to increase the Financial Health of consumers and businesses. The Data Science and Analytics team is looking for a Manager, Data Scientist. The Data Science team works on Intelligent Decisioning; Financial Certainty; Attribute, Feature, and Entity Resolution; Verification Solutions and much more. Join our team to make an impact across all sectors of the economy by consistently innovating and problem-solving. The ideal candidate is passionate about leveraging data to provide high quality customer solutions. Also, the candidate is a strong people leader who is extremely motivated, intellectually curious, analytical, and possesses an entrepreneurial mindset.
Role
Manage, Lead, mentor and grow data science teams focused on developing production-grade services and capabilities
Plan and direct data science / machine learning projects within the team.
Design and implement machine learning models for a number of financial applications including but not limited to: Transaction Classification, Temporal Analysis, Risk modeling from structured and unstructured data.
Measure, validate, implement, monitor and improve performance of both internal and external facing machine learning models.
Propose creative solutions to existing challenges that are new to the company, the financial industry and to data science.
Present technical problems and findings to business leaders internally and to clients succinctly and clearly.
Leverage best practices in machine learning and data engineering to develop scalable solutions.
Identify areas where resources fall short of needs and provide thoughtful and sustainable solutions to benefit the team
Be a strong, confident, and excellent writer and speaker, able to communicate your vision and roadmap effectively to a wide variety of stakeholders

All about you:

Managed, grew and attracted the talent to build the team
Exposure to financial transactional structured and unstructured data, transaction classification, risk evaluation and credit risk modeling is a plus.
A strong understanding of NLP, Statistical Modeling, Visualization and advanced Data Science techniques/methods.
Gain insights from text, including non-language tokens and use the thought process of annotations in text analysis.
Solve problems that are new to the company, the financial industry and to data science
SQL / Database experience is preferred
Experience with Kubernetes, Containers, Docker, REST APIs, Event Streams or other delivery mechanisms.
Familiarity with relevant technologies (e.g. Tensorflow, Python, Sklearn, Pandas, etc.).
Strong desire to collaborate and ability to come up with creative solutions.
Additional Finance and FinTech experience prefered.
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, M.S./M.B.A. preferred

Job Title
DevOps Engineer II
The NPP BizOps team is looking for a BizOps Engineer who can help us solve problems, build our CI/CD pipeline and lead Mastercard in DevOps automation and best practices.


Business Operations is leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Role

The role of business operations is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services.

A business operations engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organisations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper-focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every biz ops team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience and increase the overall value of supported applications.

Biz Ops teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of biz ops is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.

Overview:
The Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (C&I) team is responsible for product management and innovative product development of products and services to address the evolving risk & cyber security needs of all of MasterCard’s various customer segments. The C&I team was established with the responsibility to safeguard all aspects of safety and security in payments and have made great strides with new products, services, and standards, positively impacting all aspects of our current and future payment eco-system.

Ekata, a Mastercard company, is the global standard in identity verification, providing businesses worldwide the ability to link any digital transaction to the human behind it. Our Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only of its kind, uses complex machine learning to combine features derived from the billions of transactions within our proprietary network and the data from our graph to deliver industry leading risk assessment solutions.

Overview:
Identity verification team is looking for a Devops Cloud Engineer who can help us solve problems, build our CI/CD pipeline and lead Mastercard in DevOps automation and best practices.


Cloud Engineering is leading transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change & standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations. We need team members with an appetite for change and pushing the boundaries of what can be done with automation. Experience in working across development, operations, and product teams to prioritize needs and to build relationships is a must.

Mission
The role of a Cloud engineer is to be the production readiness steward for the platform. This is accomplished by closely partnering with developers to design, build, implement, and support technology services. A Cloud engineer will ensure operational criteria like system availability, capacity, performance, monitoring, self-healing, and deployment automation are implemented throughout the delivery process. Business Operations plays a key role in leading the DevOps transformation at Mastercard through our tooling and by being an advocate for change and standards throughout the development, quality, release, and product organizations.

We accomplish this transformation through supporting daily operations with a hyper focus on triage and then root cause by understanding the business impact of our products. The goal of every cloud engineering team is to shift left to be more proactive and upfront in the development process, and to proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience and increase the overall value of supported applications. Cloud Engineering teams also focus on risk management by tying all our activities together with an overarching responsibility for compliance and risk mitigation across all our environments. A biz ops focus is also on streamlining and standardizing traditional application specific support activities and centralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholders.

Ultimately, the role of cloud engineer is to align Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs. We regularly review our run state not only from an internal perspective, but also understanding and providing the feedback loop to our development partners on how we can improve the customer experience of our applications.


Qualifications

Job Title
Senior Software Engineer, Infrastructure
Who is Mastercard?

We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

Data & Services within Mastercard

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include predictive analytics, data visualization and business intelligence software.

Senior Software Engineer, Infrastructure - Data & Services Technology Team

As a senior software infrastructure engineer on the D&S Technology team, you’ll hold a valued role within a rapidly growing team inside one of the worlds most successful organizations, working closely with experienced and driven engineers to solve problems as a team. Mastercard D&S next generation platform blends industry-leading analytics, advanced software architecture, and the latest web technologies to face these problems. Our software is required to effectively decipher analytically complex insights from these problems, on which businesses base multi-million dollar business decisions.

As a member of the Platform Operations team, you will be responsible for building tools and systems that deploy and scale our applications and data in hybrid - cloud and physical - environments. We develop the infrastructure that enables the Data & Services Platforms team to build, test, deploy and host hundreds of microservices across several global datacenters. We also develop the logging, monitoring and vulnerability detection tools necessary for application developers to get insight into the security, quality and uptime of their code. Our systems are administered with infrastructure-as-code with our stack including Chef, Ansible and Terraform and our workflows are automated using Jenkins and Kubernetes

As our team continues to grow, we are looking for engineers who are passionate about DevOps, infrastructure, security and release management tooling.

Engineers work in small, flexible teams. Every team member contributes to designing, building, and testing features. There are no rigid organizational structures, and each team uses processes that work the best for that team members and projects.

Enjoy large scale DevOps challenges? Come solve them with us.

We are looking for Data Engineer II who is excited to work on building data loading and management tools on the Platforms team to deliver Test & Learn product suite, as well as contribute to and foster a collaborative workplace.

As a member of the Test & Learn team, you will apply your development skills to building industry-leading business experimentation software that loads massive amount of data for running sophisticated analytics for business users around the world. We are rapidly expanding our product offerings and innovating on how we deliver Test & Learn solutions to our clients. We are looking for an innovative engineer who can play a role in helping us scale our data integration, platform development and tackle the big challenges of the future.

What is Data & Services?
The Data & Services Team (D&S) is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. We combine traditional management consulting with our rich data assets and in-house technology to provide our clients with powerful insights and tools to drive fact-based decision making. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, our services include consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, test-and-learn business experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management. While specializing in the payments industry, Mastercard Data & Services also works closely with major retailers, airlines, and other enterprises, leveraging data and insights garnered from within and beyond its network.
We are looking for passionate and talented technologists, who share our vision for empowering our customers to make better fact-based decisions, to join us and shape the growth of our team.

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is the global technology company behind the world's fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, and a technology innovation lab. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you.

Job Title
Senior Data Engineer
Have you ever wondered how do you see offers on your credit card based on your past purchase? If you wanted to find the answer do join our team.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to not only build data pipelines but also extend the next generation of our data tools. As a Data Engineer, you will develop a clear sense of connection with our platform - as Data Engineering is the eyes through which they see the product.

Data Engineer Responsibilities

Lead day to day system development and maintenance activities of the team to meet service level agreements and create solutions with high level of innovation, cost effectiveness, high quality and faster time to market.

Support code versioning, and code deployments for Data Pipelines.

Ensure test coverage for unit testing and support integration and performance testing.

Contribute ideas to help ensure that required standards and processes are in place.

Research and evaluate current and upcoming technologies and frameworks.

Build data expertise and own data quality for your areas.

Minimum Qualifications

Extensive Java/Scala development experience.
Extensive experience with SQL.
Strong experience with Spark Processing engine.
Strong experience with Big data tools / technologies (Hive, Impala, OOZIE, Airflow, NIFI)
Strong experience with Data Modeling.
Experience in Kafka and PCF (Pivotal Cloud Foundry)
Experience analyzing data to discover opportunities and address gaps.
Experience working with cloud or on-prem Big Data platform(i.e. Netezza, Teradata, AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Data Warehouse, or similar).

Support code versioning, and code deployments for Data Pipelines.

Ensure test coverage for unit testing and support integration and performance testing.

Contribute ideas to help ensure that required standards and processes are in place.

Research and evaluate current and upcoming technologies and frameworks.

Build data expertise and own data quality for your areas.

Minimum Qualifications

Extensive Java/Scala development experience.
Extensive experience with SQL.
Strong experience with Spark Processing engine.
Strong experience with Big data tools / technologies (Hive, Impala, OOZIE, Airflow, NIFI)
Strong experience with Data Modeling.
Experience in Kafka and PCF (Pivotal Cloud Foundry)
Experience analyzing data to discover opportunities and address gaps.
Experience working with cloud or on-prem Big Data platform(i.e. Netezza, Teradata, AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Data Warehouse, or similar).

Customer Intelligence (CI) is a function of Mastercard's Global Customer Care (GCC) Organisation. A team of Data Scientists and Analysts, whose primary goal is to build intelligence that drives improvements in customer experience for Mastercard's B2B and B2C global customers. CI currently require a Data Analyst/Story Teller to join our mission of turning GCC into a true data driven organisation. The role will leverage data from multiple sources to derive analysis and actionable insights from our customer interactions with our products and services, global contact centres, and internal support teams.

Overview:
Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview
The Cyber Products team is looking for a Lead Business Analyst with cyber security and data privacy risk management experience for our RiskRecon product. The ideal candidate will help set the product vision, go-to-market strategy, and develop a roadmap to optimize product and resources to reduce bugs and rework.

Role
In this role, you will liaise between the business and IT, eliciting and translating external and internal customer needs into IT objectives, identifying possible solutions, and defining project requirements. You will have to have a deep knowledge of cyber and privacy customer needs as well as the RiskRecon product and services.

Overview:
The Lead Business Analyst, MyMPA will be part of GBSC’s Analytics & Automation Team, leading the application design, development, and process implementation of a global Essbase application. This role will also work closely with the VP of Analytics & Metrics and the Director of FP&A to establish a global solution for reporting Merchant level data and guide our technology platform's evolution as it grows to support the rapidly expanding Mastercard business. The ideal candidate will have hands on development skills combined with an ability to analyze and understand end user requirements are critical success factors within this role. This challenging role calls for an individual to balance a demanding workload and priorities which include application development and process improvements. A demonstrated ability to understand and align system and business strategies through the delivery of scalable and sustainable application design and development is key to successful performance.

If you have these skills and are passionate about empowering Pricing Analytics teams to build great things, we want to meet you!

What is GBSC Analytics and Automation?
The Global Business Services Center (GBSC) is Mastercard’s shared services organization supporting business in all countries and business units. Our GBSC mission is to add value to our partners and serve our customers by delivering operational excellence, enhanced customer experiences and focused business results. The Analytics and Automation team is the team supporting the GBSC Operations and Mastercard Business Units. We believe in power of data. We think creatively, design smart, simple to use, cost-effective solutions that empower our customer with actionable insights. The GBSC Analytics and Automation team is built upon strong contributors with leadership abilities, innovative mindsets and with strong business and technical acumen. The Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (C&I) team is responsible for product management and innovative product development of products and services to address the evolving risk & cyber security needs of all of MasterCard’s various customer segments. The C&I team was established with the responsibility to safeguard all aspects of safety and security in payments and have made great strides with new products, services and standards, positively impacting all aspects of our current and future payment eco-system.

Ekata, a Mastercard company, is the global standard in identity verification, providing businesses worldwide the ability to link any digital transaction to the human behind it. Our Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only of its kind, uses complex machine learning to combine features derived from the billions of transactions within our proprietary network and the data from our graph to deliver industry leading risk assessment solutions.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in problem solving with the ability to work cross-functionally to support the analytical needs of the organization. They will be able to leverage data to build dashboards, answer key business questions, and tell compelling stories.
